To proof.
The above letter was minuted 21 November 1890: Ml MSS.774/1, General and Administrative Council minute book, The Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (New South Wales Branch); ML MSS.2134, Administrative Council rough minutes, The Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (New South Wales Branch), Mitchell Library. Castlefield, Bondi, Sydney
I have now the honor to acknowledge receipt of and to thank you for the copy of the Transactions of your Branch of the Royal Geographical Society of Australasia issued in October 1889.

I have also to thank you for your courteous telegram in reference to the annual meeting of the members of the Sydney Branch of the Society, which ought to have been held on the 31st ultimo, but I regret to say lapsed owing to causes beyond our control

The recognition of these courtesies affords me an opportunity of which I gladly avail myself to bring under your notice and recommend to your favourable consideration the application of Mr Richard Helms for employment as zoological collector to the expedition into Central Australia which you are now organizing on behalf of Sir Thomas Elder.

I am led to understand that with his application Mr Helms forwarded to you recommendations which he had received at various times from well known natural history scientists in this colony & elsewhere, and at his request I venture to supplement those testimonials by a letter which I received from my friend Mr A. Sidney Olliff
Arthur Sidney Olliff (1865-95), collection of butterflies in Aust. Mus., Syd.
our government entomologist shortly after Sir Thomas Elders liberal and patriotic intentions became known, and transmit to you herewith.

This letter speaks for itself and [...] [...]
trust/hope that?
it may not [be]
editorial addition?
without its influence in guiding your decision in the respect to the appointment which Mr Helms seeks to obtain. I beg to subscribe my self with [...] [...] and respect —
